author: Special Correspondent
text:
Tamil Nadu Chamber of Commerce and Industry and Madurai District Tiny and Small Scale Industries Association (Maditssia) have welcomed the Union Railway Budget for not proposing increase in passenger fare and freight charges.

Both the bodies have sought introduction of double-decker train services on the busy Chennai-Madurai-Kanyakumari section. They have also welcomed the proposal to set up a rail hub for automobile sector in Chennai.

In a statement, chamber senior president S. Rethinavelu and president N. Jegatheesan said that the Delhi-Chennai dedicated freight corridor proposed in the budget should be extended upto Thoothukudi via Madurai to speed up movement of goods from Thoothukudi port. The chamber also expressed hope that important railway projects such as Villupuram-Dindigul and Madurai-Kanyakumari double line project and the long-awaited Madurai-Bodi gauge conversion projects would be provided with adequate funds for early completion.

However, the Maditssia has expressed disappointment over poor allocation for various rail projects in the State. In a statement, its president L. Murari said that long-pending demands of the association for introduction of a day express train on Madurai-Chennai section, additional trains from Madurai to Chennai and Bengaluru were not addressed.

The association welcomed the move to allow commercial utilisation of railway land. Lauding the proposal to set up two locomotive factories in the country, it wanted one of them to be set up in proposed Madurai-Thoothukudi industrial corridor.

“Demands on additional trains to Chennai and Bengaluru have not been addressed”
title: Railway budget is sweet and sour for trade bodies
